ext_description.p: A Seating_plane is a type of included specifically for the purpose of providing a description of an interface plane. One primary usage in that purpose is synchronizing the two-dimensional and three-dimensional models of a package. The seating plane simulates a mating feature when referenced as an interface plane. The seating plane simulates the interconnect substrate surface in the definition view of a package, where it is referenced in the role of a package seating plane or die seating plane. When represented by a three-dimensional plane the normal shall represent the mating surface. The normal vector shall be in the Z axis and shall be at the origin of the defining coordinate system for the three-dimensional case. A Seating_plane scope shall be a , or a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Non_feature_shape_element is a type of that is not on the physical boundary of a . A Non_feature_shape_element may be one of a , a , a . A Non_feature_shape_element may be a , and may additionally be one of a , a , a . A Non_feature_shape_element may be one of a , a , a , a , an , a , a , or a . An Express representation of this type description is found in the Note below and shall be used for implementation purposes.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Non_feature_shape_element is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Non_feature_shape_element as its . There shall be zero or more for a Non_feature_shape_element.

specifies the for the Non_feature_shape_element. The scope may specify the role of a , a , a , a , or a for the Non_feature_shape_element.
If associated_usage_concept is provided, then element_shape will be provided as well.
The combination of name inherited from and scope shall be unique within a population of Non_feature_shape_element.
The Non_feature_shape_element shall not be on the boundary of a .
A Non_feature_shape_element_relationship is a type of that associates a with a from which the is derived.
one of the instances of that is a part of the relationship for the Non_feature_shape_element_relationship.
the other instance of that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent up on the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
The combination of the relating shape element inherited from and related shape element inherited from shall be unique within a population of Non_feature_shape_element_relationship.

ext_description.p: A Non_feature_shape_definition is a type of . A Non_feature_shape_definition may be one of a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a . A Non_feature_shape_definition may also be one of a , or a . A Non_feature_shape_definition shall be used to represent annotation information or other shape property information that is not appropriate for .
ext_description.note: Shape information that is derived from a physical shape and whose algorithmic derivation details are unavailable may be exchanged with this Application Object.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Non_feature_shape_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the role of the for the Non_feature_shape_definition.

ext_description.p: A Reference_graphic_registration_mark is a type of that is annotation graphic included in the design model for a pcb. A set of Reference_graphic_registration_mark is used to visually indicate a reference alignment for tooling purposes. The geometric representation for a Reference_graphic_registration_mark is identical to the geometric representation of the for a product that is a tool, usually a phototool.
ext_description.note: The difference between a Reference_graphic_registration_mark and a is that the Reference_graphic_registration_mark is annotation and therefore is not to be operated on as part of the design geometric model wheras the is a real feature of the tool model and is operated on as part of the tool geometric model.

note.p: Reference_graphic_registration_marks are included for complete CAD to CAD data exchange purposes since many 2D CAD applications include geometry representing these tooling marks as part of the standard CAD file output.

ext_description.p: A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship is a type of . A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship is the association of a with its to create a resultant . In the case where the placement is not supplied, both Non_feature_shape_definitions are in the same geometric context.
ext_description.note: A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship is included to support composition of non-feature and non-physical shapes. and other types of location Application Objects support composition of assembly or interconnect shapes. supports composition of shapes in the usage view. The name is generic to support extensibility. Mirroring is possible by use of . The use of mirroring should be carefully considered toavoid confusion in receiving systems.
ext_description.example: A Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship would be used to transform a keepout shape for a detail into an overall keepout shape. It may be that the detail shape is a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies one role of the for the Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship. This role name is redeclared from the attribute inherited from .
an instance specifies one role of the for the Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship. This role name is redeclared from the attribute inherited from .
an instance specifies the role of the or of the for the Non_feature_shape_composition_relationship.
Either the related_feature_shape_placement exists or the same context shall be referenced by the related_feature_shape and the resultant_feature_shape.
